title: Hancock and Luffy Will Mirror Rayleigh and Shakky's Relationship
summary: Fans theorize that Hancock and Luffy's relationship will parallel Rayleigh and Shakky, with Hancock eventually ending up with Luffy after his adventure concludes.
fullText: Recent flashbacks introduced Shakky, who resembles Hancock as the most beautiful woman of her era. Everyone was attracted to Shakky except Silvers Rayleigh - the only person who showed her no care is the one she developed love sickness for. Fans know that Shakky and Rayleigh end up together. If Oda follows this pattern, it suggests Luffy and Hancock will also end up together once his adventure ends, mirroring the relationship between the previous generation's Pirate King's first mate and a former empress.
author: One Piece Fandom (Multiple Contributors)

source.title: One Piece: Luffy & Boa Hancock's Relationship, Explained

title: The Pirate King and Pirate Empress Pairing
summary: Theory that Luffy will marry Hancock once he becomes Pirate King, mirroring Gol D. Roger's relationship dynamic.
fullText: Fans theorize that Luffy is most probably going to marry Hancock once he fulfills his goal of becoming Pirate King, just like Gol D. Roger did. The pairing of a Pirate King and a Pirate Empress (the leader of Amazon Lily and captain of the Kuja Pirates) would be a fitting conclusion to their relationship, especially given Hancock's unwavering devotion established in Episode 417 when she agrees to help him despite the risks.
author: One Piece Fandom

source.title: One Piece: Oda Might Have Already Revealed Who Luffy Will End Up With

title: Nefertari D. Lili Was the First Love Sickness Victim
summary: Theory that Nefertari D. Lili was in love with Joy Boy and was the first to suffer from love sickness, potentially founding the Kuja tribe.
fullText: A fan theory suggests that just like Boa Hancock fell in love with Luffy (as revealed in Episode 417), Nefertari D. Lili was in love with Joy Boy in the ancient past. The theory proposes that Lili was the first character to be diagnosed with love sickness and may have founded the Kuja tribe and Amazon Lily. This would explain why love sickness is specifically a condition that affects Amazon Lily empresses - it could be genetic or cultural legacy passed down from Lili. The parallel between Hancock/Luffy and Lili/Joy Boy would add another layer to the series' mythology.
author: Fandom Wire Contributors

source.title: One Piece: Nefertari D. Lili and Joy Boy's Truth Can Explain Boa Hancock's Incurable Disease

title: Gloriosa (Nyon) Loved a Rocks Pirate
summary: Theory that Elder Nyon survived love sickness because she fell in love with a member of the Rocks Pirates crew.
fullText: Fans theorize that Gloriosa (Elder Nyon), who reveals in Episode 417 that she survived love sickness by leaving Amazon Lily, may have fallen in love with one of the Rocks Pirates. This theory suggests she left the island during the era when the Rocks Pirates were active (before the God Valley incident). The theory would explain her survival of love sickness and her understanding of the condition. Some speculate it could have been a prominent Rocks member, which would add historical depth to her character and connect Amazon Lily to the larger world of piracy.
author: CBR and One Piece Fandom

source.title: One Piece Theory: Gloriosa Loved a Rocks Pirate

title: Love Sickness as Oda's Exploration of Suicide Themes
summary: A darker theory suggesting that love sickness represents Oda's way of exploring suicide themes in the series.
fullText: A theory posted on Reddit suggests there is a possibility that Eiichiro Oda might explore the dark theme of suicide through Boa Hancock and the Love Sickness condition revealed in Episode 417. The theory notes that some empresses died from love sickness, which occurs when they suppress their emotions. Some fans speculate this might be the only way Oda explores suicide themes, as the condition could force an empress to waste away if she doesn't follow her heart. However, the theory is controversial as it implies a darker interpretation of what is presented as a romantic/comedic element in the series.
author: u/nouratef (Reddit)

source.title: One Piece is Not for Kids if Oda Reveals the Dark Fate of Boa Hancock

title: Hancock's Love Sickness Was Cured at Impel Down
summary: Counter-theory arguing that Hancock's love sickness was already cured during the Impel Down arc.
fullText: Some fans argue that Hancock's love sickness was cured long before the timeskip, as Elder Nyon mentioned in Episode 417 that what would save or cure Hancock was going to Impel Down along with Luffy to help him break in. According to this interpretation, the act of following her love and helping him (rather than suppressing her feelings) is what cured the condition. However, others counter that Hancock's continued emotional fixation with Luffy means the Love Sickness hasn't been fully cured - she just isn't dying from it anymore. The debate centers on whether 'curing' means removing the love or simply surviving it.
author: Tumblr User: warlordgab
